content.question: A car travels on a straight track. During the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 60 seconds, the car’s velocity v, measured in feet per second, and acceleration a, measured in feet per second per second, are continuous functions. The table above shows selected values of these functions. (a) Using appropriate units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@438F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the car's motion. Approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@438F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using a trapezoidal approximation with the three subintervals determined by the table.

frqParts.text: A car travels on a straight track. During the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 60 seconds, the car’s velocity v, measured in feet per second, and acceleration a, measured in feet per second per second, are continuous functions. The table above shows selected values of these functions. (a) Using appropriate units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@438F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the car's motion. Approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@438F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using a trapezoidal approximation with the three subintervals determined by the table.

(b) Using appropriate units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@403E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the car's motion. Find the exact value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@403E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
(c) For 0 < t < 60, must there be a time t when v(t) = -5? Justify your answer.
(d) For 0 < t < 60, must there be a time t when a(t) = 0? Justify your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
